org.grouplens.lenskit.data.history

Class AbstractUserHistory<E extends Event>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • org.grouplens.lenskit.data.history.AbstractUserHistory<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<E>, java.util.Collection<E>, java.util.List<E>, UserHistory<E>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BasicUserHistory

    public abstract class AbstractUserHistory<E extends Event>
extends java.util.AbstractList<E>
implements UserHistory<E>

    An abstract implementation of UserHistory to provide default implementations of convenience methods.

    Compatibility
    Public (may require additional method implementations across minor revisions)

    • Method Detail

      • itemSet

        public LongSet itemSet()
        Description copied from interface: UserHistory

        Get the set of items touched by events in this history. Only nonnegative item IDs are considered.

        Specified by:
        itemSet in interface UserHistory<E extends Event>
        Returns:
        The set of all item IDs used in events in this history.

      • memoize

        public <T> T memoize(Function<? super UserHistory<E>,? extends T> func)
        Description copied from interface: UserHistory

        Apply a function to this history, memoizing its return value. Used for caching things like summaries. The function should appropriately define its Function.equals(Object) and Object.hashCode() methods in order for memoization to work well.

        This method is not guaranteed to be synchronized. It is safe to memoize distinct functions in parallel, but potentially-parallel use of the same function must be synchronized by client code or the function may be called twice. The implementation in AbstractUserHistory uses a ConcurrentHashMap. Multiple calls are therefore safe, but may result in extra work. All implementations must maintain this safety guarantee, although they may do so by synchronizing this method.

        Specified by:
        memoize in interface UserHistory<E extends Event>
        Parameters:
        func - The function to call and memoize.
        Returns:
        The return value of func.
